speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: SCENE X. The camp of the Volsces.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: A flourish. Cornets. Enter TULLUS AUFIDIUS, bloody, with two or three Soldiers

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: The town is ta'en!

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: 'Twill be deliver'd back on good condition.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Condition!

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: I would I were a Roman; for I cannot,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Being a Volsce, be that I am. Condition!

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: What good condition can a treaty find

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: I' the part that is at mercy? Five times, Marcius,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: I have fought with thee: so often hast thou beat me,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: And wouldst do so, I think, should we encounter

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: As often as we eat. By the elements,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: If e'er again I meet him beard to beard,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: He's mine, or I am his: mine emulation

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Hath not that honour in't it had; for where

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: I thought to crush him in an equal force,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: True sword to sword, I'll potch at him some way

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Or wrath or craft may get him.

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: He's the devil.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Bolder, though not so subtle. My valour's poison'd

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: With only suffering stain by him; for him

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Shall fly out of itself: nor sleep nor sanctuary,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Being naked, sick, nor fane nor Capitol,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: The prayers of priests nor times of sacrifice,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Embarquements all of fury, shall lift up

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Their rotten privilege and custom 'gainst

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: My hate to Marcius: where I find him, were it

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: At home, upon my brother's guard, even there,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Against the hospitable canon, would I

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Wash my fierce hand in's heart. Go you to the city;

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Learn how 'tis held; and what they are that must

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Be hostages for Rome.

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: Will not you go?

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: I am attended at the cypress grove: I pray you--

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: 'Tis south the city mills--bring me word thither

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: How the world goes, that to the pace of it

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: I may spur on my journey.

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: I shall, sir.

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: Exeunt
